title: Death Row inmates to be executed next month including killer backed by his victim's family

Four killers are due to be executed in the US next month after years on death row - including a man backed by the family of the girl he killed.

Cop killer Patrick Murphy, Rodney Reed, Charles Rhines and Justen Hall are all set to be put to death in November.

All but one of the executions will take place in Texas.

Three other planned killings are not set to go ahead, with double killer Cleveland Jackson given a reprieve until January 2021.

James Dailey, who killed a 14-year-old girl, and Tim Jones Jr, convicted of murdering his five children, have been given stays of execution.

Here we look at the four executions that, barring any last minute appeal, are set to go ahead.

Patrick Murphy - Texas 7 escapee and cop killer

Murphy, 57, is on death row for the Christmas Eve 2000 murder of Police Officer Aubrey Hawkins.

He and six other inmates known as the Texas 7 had escaped prison on December 13 and went on to commit a number of further crimes.

One of the seven committed suicide before he could be recaptured, with the other six sentenced to death.

Four have been killed leaving Murphy and one other man, Randy Halprin, on death row.

Murphy said in a prison interview that he doesn't want to die, but also doesn't want to spend the rest of his life on death row.

“I’m not really afraid of death," he told reporters. "I’ve accepted that I’m really at peace with it. Do I want to die?

"Not necessarily, but I don’t wanna spend the rest of my life the way I am right now.”

He's due to be executed on November 13.

Charles Rhines - Donut shop murder

In 1992 Rhines was caught robbing a donut shop in Rapid City, South Dakota by an employee.

Donnivan Schaeffer, 22, was stabbed in the abdomen and back.

Then, as Schaeffer pleaded for his life, Rhines thrust the blade into the base of his skull the court heard.

After 27 years on death row, the killer is set to be executed on November 3.

Justen Hall - Electrical cord killer

Hall was sent to death row in 2005, three years after strangling a woman with an electrical cord.

His attorneys raised concerns about DNA testing on the cord used to kill Melissa Billhartz and suggested his confession was coerced.

But in 2016, Hall asked to waive his appeals in a letter to the court.

“These walls 24/7 have broken me,” he wrote. “It is taking every last ounce of will to even make it from day to day.”

He's due to be executed on November 6.

Rodney Reed - Rape and murder

Rodney Reed was charged with the murder of 20-year-old Stacey Stites in 1996.

He was convicted of strangling her during an aggravated sexual assault in Bastrop, Texas.

But the victim's family have since made big efforts to save him - as they claim she was actually strangled to death by a her police officer ex-boyfriend.

"We have to stand up and say, look, there are too many questions to execute a man without them all being answered," the family said in a previous statement.

Originally due to be executed in 2015, he's due to be put to death in Texas on November 20.
description: Cop killer Patrick Murphy, Rodney Reed, Charles Rhines and Justen Hall are all due to be put to death in the US in November
